intro: Swinglea, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters in its natural habitat. Swinglea has lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy, and it produces fragrant, clustered flowers in the spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
